titlestmt.subtitle: Papers, 1919-1920, of Mary Emerson Hurlbutt at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

did.abstract: The Hurlbutt mss., 1919-1920, consists of letters from Mary Emerson Hurlbutt, 1888-1980, social service worker, to her family from the Czechoslovak Republic where she was serving with the Survey of Prague.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in Czech and English.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mary Emerson Hurlbutt, 1888-1980, was a social service worker from Stamford, Connecticut. She received her bachelor's degree from Vassar College and her master's from Columbia University. She specialized in social welfare and health and served as dean of the Czech-American summer training school for social work under the auspices of the American Young Women's Christian Association. She is the author of Sociální péče o jednotlivce v Praze [Social welfare of individuals in Prague] (1920).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Hurlbutt mss., 1919-1920, consists of letters from Mary Emerson Hurlbutt, 1888-1980, social service worker, to her family from the Czechoslovak Republic where she was serving with the Survey of Prague. The letters convey personal news to her family, describe her work, the economic conditions in the Czecholoslovak Republic and in Vienna, and the relief work of the Society of Friends. Included are letters describing her trip from the United States to Prague in 1919 with visits to London and Paris en route and a trip to Italy in January, 1920.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Hurlbutt mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See the Mitchell mss., Mitchell mss. II, Hess mss., and Masaryk mss., also at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
